heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 02 February 2026, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 110 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 213 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 110.2m lower than yesterday, 159.5m lower than the past week, 212.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 604m to a maximum of 818m, averaging 572.6m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 732.1m and 785.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Showers, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and light levels will be low during the day. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (95%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
